summary.long: Hebrews is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Long ago God spoke to our ancestors in many and various ways by the prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in these last days he has spoken to us by a Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, through whom he also created the worlds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the reflection of God’s glory and the exact imprint of God’s very being, and he sustains all things by his powerful word. When he had made purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having become as much superior to angels as the name he has inherited is more excellent than theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For to which of the angels did God ever say,
“You are my Son;
    today I have begotten you”?
Or again,
“I will be his Father,
    and he will be my Son”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And again, when he brings the firstborn into the world, he says,
“Let all God’s angels worship him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the angels he says,
“He makes his angels winds
    and his servants flames of fire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But of the Son he says,
“Your throne, O God, is forever and ever,
    and the scepter of righteousness is the scepter of your kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
they will perish, but you remain;
    they will all wear out like clothing;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
like a cloak you will roll them up,
    and like clothing they will be changed.
But you are the same,
    and your years will never end.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And to which of the angels has he ever said,
“Sit at my right hand
    until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are not all angels spirits in the divine service, sent to serve for the sake of those who are to inherit salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore we must pay greater attention to what we have heard, so that we do not drift away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the message declared through angels proved valid, and every transgression or disobedience received a just penalty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how will we escape if we neglect so great a salvation? It was declared at first through the Lord, and it was confirmed for us by those who heard him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while God added his testimony by signs and wonders and various miracles and by gifts of the Holy Spirit, distributed according to his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now God did not subject the coming world, about which we are speaking, to angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But someone has testified somewhere,
“What are humans that you are mindful of them
    or mortals that you care for them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made them for a little while lower than the angels;
    you have crowned them with glory and honor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
subjecting all things under their feet.”
Now in subjecting all things to them, God left nothing outside their control. As it is, we do not yet see everything in subjection to them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we do see Jesus, who for a little while was made lower than the angels, now crowned with glory and honor because of the suffering of death, so that by the grace of God he might taste death for everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was fitting that God, for whom and through whom all things exist, in bringing many children to glory, should make the pioneer of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the one who sanctifies and those who are sanctified all have one Father. For this reason Jesus is not ashamed to call them brothers and sisters,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And again,
“I will put my trust in him.”
And again,
“Here am I and the children whom God has given me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since, therefore, the children share flesh and blood, he himself likewise shared the same things, so that through death he might destroy the one who has the power of death, that is, the devil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and free those who all their lives were held in slavery by the fear of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is clear that he did not come to help angels but the descendants of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore he had to become like his brothers and sisters in every respect, so that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in the service of God, to make a sacrifice of atonement for the sins of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he himself was tested by what he suffered, he is able to help those who are being tested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, holy brothers and sisters, partners in a heavenly calling, consider Jesus, the apostle and high priest of our confession,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was faithful to the one who appointed him, just as Moses also “was faithful in all God’s house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet Jesus is worthy of more glory than Moses, just as the builder of a house has more honor than the house itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For every house is built by someone, but the builder of all things is God.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Moses was faithful in all God’s house as a servant, to testify to the things that would be spoken later.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Christ, however, was faithful over God’s house as a son, and we are his house if we hold firm the boldness and the pride inspired by hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, as the Holy Spirit says,
“Today, if you hear his voice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion,
    as on the day of testing in the wilderness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
where your ancestors put me to the test,
though they had seen my works
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for forty years.
Therefore I was angry with that generation,
and I said, ‘They always go astray in their hearts,
    and they have not known my ways.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As in my anger I swore,
    ‘They will not enter my rest.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take care, brothers and sisters, that none of you may have an evil, unbelieving heart that turns away from the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But exhort one another every day, as long as it is called “today,” so that none of you may be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have become partners of Christ, if only we hold our first confidence firm to the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is said,
“Today, if you hear his voice,
do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now who were they who heard and rebelled? Was it not all those who left Egypt under the leadership of Moses?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And with whom was he angry forty years? Was it not those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to whom did he swear that they would not enter his rest, if not to those who were disobedient?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we see that they were unable to enter because of unbelief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, while the promise of entering his rest is still open, let us take care that none of you should seem to have failed to reach it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For indeed the good news came to us just as to them, but the message they heard did not benefit them because they were not united by faith with those who listened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For we who have believed are entering that rest, just as God has said,
“As in my anger I swore,
‘They shall not enter my rest,’ ”
though his works were finished since the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For somewhere it speaks about the seventh day as follows, “And God rested on the seventh day from all his works.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again in this place it says, “They shall not enter my rest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since therefore it remains open for some to enter it and those who formerly received the good news failed to enter because of disobedience,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
again he sets a certain day—“today”—saying through David much later, in the words already quoted,
“Today, if you hear his voice,
do not harden your hearts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not speak later about another day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, a Sabbath rest still remains for the people of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for those who enter God’s rest also rest from their labors as God did from his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us therefore make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one may fall through such disobedience as theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the word of God is living and active and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing until it divides soul from spirit, joints from marrow; it is able to judge the thoughts and intentions of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And before him no creature is hidden, but all are naked and laid bare to the eyes of the one to whom we must render an account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since, then, we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast to our confession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who in every respect has been tested as we are, yet without sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us therefore approach the throne of grace with boldness, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in time of need.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every high priest chosen from among mortals is put in charge of things pertaining to God on their behalf, to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is able to deal gently with the ignorant and wayward, since he himself is subject to weakness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because of this he must offer sacrifice for his own sins as well as for those of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one does not presume to take this honor but takes it only when called by God, just as Aaron was.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
as he says also in another place,
“You are a priest forever,
    according to the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of his flesh, Jesus offered up prayers and supplications, with loud cries and tears, to the one who was able to save him from death, and he was heard because of his reverent submission.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although he was a Son, he learned obedience through what he suffered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and having been made perfect, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having been designated by God a high priest according to the order of Melchizedek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: About this we have much to say that is hard to explain, since you have become sluggish in hearing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you again the basic elements of the oracles of God. You need milk, not solid food,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for everyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is unskilled in the word of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But solid food is for the mature, for those whose faculties have been trained by practice to distinguish good from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let us go on toward perfection, leaving behind the basic teaching about Christ and not laying again the foundation: repentance from dead works and faith toward God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: instruction about baptisms and laying on of hands, resurrection of the dead and eternal judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we will do this, if God permits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is impossible to restore again to repentance those who have once been enlightened and have tasted the heavenly gift and have shared in the Holy Spirit
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then have fallen away, since they are crucifying again the Son of God to their own harm and are holding him up to contempt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ground that drinks up the rain falling on it repeatedly and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is cultivated receives a blessing from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it produces thorns and thistles, it is worthless and on the verge of being cursed; its end is to be burned over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though we speak in this way, beloved, we are confident of better things in your case, things that belong to salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God is not unjust; he will not overlook your work and the love that you showed for his sake in serving the saints, as you still do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we want each one of you to show the same diligence so as to realize the full assurance of hope to the very end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may not become sluggish but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When God made a promise to Abraham, because he had no one greater by whom to swear, he swore by himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “I will surely bless you and multiply you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And thus Abraham, having patiently endured, obtained the promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humans, of course, swear by someone greater than themselves, and an oath given as confirmation puts an end to all dispute among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the same way, when God desired to show even more clearly to the heirs of the promise the unchangeable character of his purpose, he guaranteed it by an oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that through two unchangeable things, in which it is impossible that God would prove false, we who have taken refuge might be strongly encouraged to seize the hope set before us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have this hope, a sure and steadfast anchor of the soul, a hope that enters the inner shrine behind the curtain,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where Jesus, a forerunner on our behalf, has entered, having become a high priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This “Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the Most High God, met Abraham as he was returning from defeating the kings and blessed him,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to him Abraham apportioned “one-tenth of everything.” His name, in the first place, means “king of righteousness”; next, he is also king of Salem, that is, “king of peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life but resembling the Son of God, he remains a priest forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See how great he is! Even Abraham the patriarch gave him a tenth of the spoils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those descendants of Levi who receive the priestly office have a commandment in the law to collect tithes from the people, that is, from their kindred, though these also are descended from Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this man, who does not belong to their ancestry, collected tithes from Abraham and blessed him who had received the promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is beyond dispute that the inferior is blessed by the superior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the one case, tithes are received by those who are mortal; in the other, by one of whom it is testified that he lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One might even say that Levi himself, who receives tithes, paid tithes through Abraham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for he was still in the loins of his ancestor when Melchizedek met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if perfection had been attainable through the Levitical priesthood—for the people received the law under this priesthood—what further need would there have been to speak of another priest arising according to the order of Melchizedek rather than one according to the order of Aaron?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when there is a change in the priesthood, there is necessarily a change in the law as well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the one of whom these things are spoken belonged to another tribe, from which no one has ever served at the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is evident that our Lord was descended from Judah, and in connection with that tribe Moses said nothing about priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is even more obvious when another priest arises, resembling Melchizedek,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one who has become a priest, not through a legal requirement concerning physical descent but through the power of an indestructible life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is attested of him,
“You are a priest forever,
    according to the order of Melchizedek.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is, on the one hand, the abrogation of an earlier commandment because it was weak and ineffectual
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for the law made nothing perfect); there is, on the other hand, the introduction of a better hope through which we approach God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was confirmed with an oath, for others have become priests without an oath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but this one became a priest with an oath because of the one who said to him,
“The Lord has sworn
    and will not change his mind,
‘You are a priest forever’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: accordingly Jesus has also become the guarantor of a better covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the former priests were many in number because they were prevented by death from continuing in office,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he holds his priesthood permanently because he continues forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consequently, he is able for all time to save those who approach God through him, since he always lives to make intercession for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it was fitting that we should have such a high priest, holy, blameless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and exalted above the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Unlike the other high priests, he has no need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for his own sins and then for those of the people; this he did once for all when he offered himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law appoints as high priests humans, who are subject to weakness, but the word of the oath, which came later than the law, appoints a Son who has been made perfect forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the main point in what we are saying is this: we have such a high priest, one who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a minister in the sanctuary and the true tent that the Lord, and not any mortal, has set up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every high priest is appointed to offer gifts and sacrifices; hence it is necessary for this priest also to have something to offer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if he were on earth, he would not be a priest at all, since there are already those who offer gifts according to the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They offer worship in a sanctuary that is a sketch and shadow of the heavenly one, just as Moses was warned when he was about to erect the tent. For, God said, “See that you make everything according to the pattern that was shown you on the mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus has now obtained a more excellent ministry, and to that degree he is the mediator of a better covenant, which has been enacted on the basis of better promises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if that first covenant had been faultless, there would have been no need to look for a second one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God finds fault with them when he says:
“The days are surely coming, says the Lord,
    when I will establish a new covenant with the house of Israel
    and with the house of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
not like the covenant that I made with their ancestors
    on the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt,
for they did not continue in my covenant,
    and so I had no concern for them, says the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel
    after those days, says the Lord:
I will put my laws in their minds
    and write them on their hearts,
and I will be their God,
    and they shall be my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they shall not teach one another
    or say to each other, ‘Know the Lord,’
for they shall all know me,
    from the least of them to the greatest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will be merciful toward their iniquities,
    and I will remember their sins no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In speaking of a new covenant, he has made the first one obsolete, and what is obsolete and growing old will soon disappear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first covenant had regulations for worship and an earthly sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a tent was constructed, the first one, in which were the lampstand, the table, and the bread of the Presence; this is called the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behind the second curtain was a tent called the holy of holies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In it stood the golden altar of incense and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold, in which there were a golden urn holding the manna, and Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Of these things we cannot speak now in detail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These preparations having thus been made, the priests go continually into the first tent to carry out their ritual duties,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but only the high priest goes into the second, and he but once a year and not without taking the blood that he offers for himself and for the sins committed unintentionally by the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By this the Holy Spirit indicates that the way into the sanctuary has not yet been disclosed as long as the first tent is still standing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a symbol of the present time, indicating that gifts and sacrifices are offered that cannot perfect the conscience of the worshiper
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but deal only with food and drink and various baptisms, regulations for the body imposed until the time comes to set things right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Christ came as a high priest of the good things that have come, then through the greater and more perfect tent (not made with hands, that is, not of this creation),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he entered once for all into the holy place, not with the blood of goats and calves but with his own blood, thus obtaining eternal redemption.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the blood of goats and bulls and the sprinkling of the ashes of a heifer sanctifies those who have been defiled so that their flesh is purified,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, purify our conscience from dead works to worship the living God!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason he is the mediator of a new covenant, so that those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance, because a death has occurred that redeems them from the transgressions under the first covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where a will is involved, the death of the one who made it must be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a will takes effect only at death, since it is not in force as long as the one who made it is alive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hence not even the first covenant was inaugurated without blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when every commandment had been told to all the people by Moses in accordance with the law, he took the blood of calves and goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop, and sprinkled both the scroll itself and all the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “This is the blood of the covenant that God has ordained for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the same way he sprinkled with the blood both the tent and all the vessels used in worship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, under the law almost everything is purified with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus it was necessary for the sketches of the heavenly things to be purified with these rites, but the heavenly things themselves need better sacrifices than these.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Christ did not enter a sanctuary made by human hands, a mere copy of the true one, but he entered into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God on our behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor was it to offer himself again and again, as the high priest enters the holy place year after year with blood that is not his own,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for then he would have had to suffer again and again since the foundation of the world. But as it is, he has appeared once for all at the end of the ages to remove sin by the sacrifice of himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And just as it is appointed for mortals to die once and after that the judgment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so Christ, having been offered once to bear the sins of many, will appear a second time, not to deal with sin but to save those who are eagerly waiting for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the law has only a shadow of the good things to come and not the true form of these realities, it can never, by the same sacrifices that are continually offered year after year, make perfect those who approach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, would they not have ceased being offered, since the worshipers, cleansed once for all, would no longer have any consciousness of sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in these sacrifices there is a reminder of sin year after year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
in burnt offerings and sin offerings
    you have taken no pleasure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, ‘See, I have come to do your will, O God’
    (in the scroll of the book it is written of me).”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he said above, “You have neither desired nor taken pleasure in sacrifices and offerings and burnt offerings and sin offerings” (these are offered according to the law),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then he added, “See, I have come to do your will.” He abolishes the first in order to establish the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is by God’s will that we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And every priest stands day after day at his service, offering again and again the same sacrifices that can never take away sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Christ had offered for all time a single sacrifice for sins, “he sat down at the right hand of God,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and since then has been waiting “until his enemies would be made a footstool for his feet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by a single offering he has perfected for all time those who are sanctified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Holy Spirit also testifies to us, for after saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“This is the covenant that I will make with them
    after those days, says the Lord:
I will put my laws in their hearts,
    and I will write them on their minds,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and he adds,
“I will remember their sins and their lawless deeds no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Where there is forgiveness of these, there is no longer any offering for sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, my brothers and sisters, since we have confidence to enter the sanctuary by the blood of Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by the new and living way that he opened for us through the curtain (that is, through his flesh),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and since we have a great priest over the house of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let us approach with a true heart in full assurance of faith, with our hearts sprinkled clean from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us hold fast to the confession of our hope without wavering, for he who has promised is faithful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another, and all the more as you see the Day approaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if we willfully persist in sin after having received the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but a fearful prospect of judgment and a fury of fire that will consume the adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who has violated the law of Moses dies without mercy “on the testimony of two or three witnesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How much worse punishment do you think will be deserved by those who have spurned the Son of God, profaned the blood of the covenant by which they were sanctified, and outraged the Spirit of grace?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we know the one who said, “Vengeance is mine; I will repay.” And again, “The Lord will judge his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But recall those earlier days when, after you had been enlightened, you endured a hard struggle with sufferings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sometimes being publicly exposed to insults and afflictions and sometimes becoming partners with those so treated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you had compassion for those who were in prison, and you cheerfully accepted the plundering of your possessions, knowing that you yourselves possessed something better and more lasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not, therefore, abandon that boldness of yours; it brings a great reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you need endurance, so that when you have done the will of God you may receive what was promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For yet
“in a very little while,
    the one who is coming will come and will not delay,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but my righteous one will live by faith.
    My soul takes no pleasure in anyone who shrinks back.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we are not among those who shrink back and so are lost but among those who have faith and so preserve our souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now faith is the assurance of things hoped for, the conviction of things not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, by faith our ancestors received approval.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith we understand that the worlds were prepared by the word of God, so that what is seen was made from things that are not visible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abel offered to God a more acceptable sacrifice than Cain’s. Through this he received approval as righteous, God himself giving approval to his gifts; he died, but through his faith he still speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Enoch was taken so that he did not experience death, and “he was not found, because God had taken him.” For it was attested before he was taken away that “he had pleased God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And without faith it is impossible to please him, for whoever would approach God must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who seek him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Noah, warned by God about events as yet unseen, respected the warning and built an ark to save his household; by this he condemned the world and became an heir to the righteousness that is in accordance with faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to set out for a place that he was to receive as an inheritance, and he set out, not knowing where he was going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he stayed for a time in the land he had been promised, as in a foreign land, living in tents, as did Isaac and Jacob, who were heirs with him of the same promise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he looked forward to the city that has foundations, whose architect and builder is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith, with Sarah’s involvement, he received power of procreation, even though he was too old, because he considered him faithful who had promised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore from one person, and this one as good as dead, descendants were born, “as many as the stars of heaven and as the innumerable grains of sand by the seashore.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of these died in faith without having received the promises, but from a distance they saw and greeted them. They confessed that they were strangers and foreigners on the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for people who speak in this way make it clear that they are seeking a homeland.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If they had been thinking of the land that they had left behind, they would have had opportunity to return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as it is, they desire a better homeland, that is, a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God; indeed, he has prepared a city for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Abraham, when put to the test, offered up Isaac. He who had received the promises was ready to offer up his only son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of whom he had been told, “It is through Isaac that descendants shall be named for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He considered the fact that God is able even to raise someone from the dead—and, figuratively speaking, he did receive him back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Isaac invoked blessings for the future on Jacob and Esau.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Jacob, when dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph, “bowing in worship over the top of his staff.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Joseph, at the end of his life, made mention of the exodus of the Israelites and gave instructions about his burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Moses was hidden by his parents for three months after his birth, because they saw that the child was beautiful, and they were not afraid of the king’s edict.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Moses, when he was grown up, refused to be called a son of Pharaoh’s daughter,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: choosing rather to share ill-treatment with the people of God than to enjoy the fleeting pleasures of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He considered abuse suffered for the Christ to be greater wealth than the treasures of Egypt, for he was looking ahead to the reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he left Egypt, unafraid of the king’s anger, for he persevered as though he saw him who is invisible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, so that the destroyer of the firstborn would not touch the firstborn of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith the people passed through the Red Sea as if it were dry land, but when the Egyptians attempted to do so they were drowned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell after they had been encircled for seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By faith Rahab the prostitute did not perish with those who were disobedient, because she had received the spies in peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what more should I say? For time would fail me to tell of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, of David and Samuel and the prophets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who through faith conquered kingdoms, administered justice, obtained promises, shut the mouths of lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, were made strong out of weakness, became mighty in war, put foreign armies to flight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Women received their dead by resurrection. Others were tortured, refusing to accept release, in order to obtain a better resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others suffered mocking and flogging and even chains and imprisonment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were stoned to death; they were sawn in two; they were killed by the sword; they went about in skins of sheep and goats, destitute, persecuted, tormented—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of whom the world was not worthy. They wandered in deserts and mountains and in caves and holes in the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet all these, though they were commended for their faith, did not receive what was promised,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since God had provided something better so that they would not, apart from us, be made perfect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight and the sin that clings so closely, and let us run with perseverance the race that is set before us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking to Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of faith, who for the sake of the joy that was set before him endured the cross, disregarding its shame, and has taken his seat at the right hand of the throne of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consider him who endured such hostility against himself from sinners, so that you may not grow weary in your souls or lose heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your struggle against sin you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you have forgotten the exhortation that addresses you as children—
“My child, do not regard lightly the discipline of the Lord
    or lose heart when you are punished by him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord disciplines those whom he loves
    and chastises every child whom he accepts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Endure trials for the sake of discipline. God is treating you as children, for what child is there whom a parent does not discipline?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do not have that discipline in which all children share, then you are illegitimate and not his children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, we had human parents to discipline us, and we respected them. Should we not be even more willing to be subject to the Father of spirits and live?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they disciplined us for a short time as seemed best to them, but he disciplines us for our good, in order that we may share his holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, discipline always seems painful rather than pleasant at the time, but later it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been trained by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore lift your drooping hands and strengthen your weak knees
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame may not be put out of joint but rather be healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pursue peace with everyone and the holiness without which no one will see the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See to it that no one fails to obtain the grace of God, that no root of bitterness springs up and causes trouble and through it many become defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See to it that no one becomes an immoral and godless person, as Esau was, who sold his birthright for a single meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that later, when he wanted to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, for he found no chance to repent, even though he sought the blessing with tears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have not come to something that can be touched, a blazing fire, and darkness, and gloom, and a tempest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the sound of a trumpet, and a voice whose words made the hearers beg that not another word be spoken to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For they could not endure the order that was given, “If even an animal touches the mountain, it shall be stoned to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, so terrifying was the sight that Moses said, “I tremble with fear.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have come to Mount Zion and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to innumerable angels in festal gathering,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to the assembly of the firstborn who are enrolled in heaven, and to God the judge of all, and to the spirits of the righteous made perfect,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood that speaks a better word than the blood of Abel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that you do not refuse the one who is speaking, for if they did not escape when they refused the one who warned them on earth, how much less will we escape if we reject the one who warns from heaven!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time his voice shook the earth, but now he has promised, “Yet once more I will shake not only the earth but also the heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This phrase, “Yet once more,” indicates the removal of what is shaken—that is, created things—so that what cannot be shaken may remain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us show gratitude, by which we may offer to God an acceptable worship with reverence and awe,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for indeed our God is a consuming fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let mutual affection continue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not neglect to show hospitality to strangers, for by doing that some have entertained angels without knowing it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember those who are in prison, as though you were in prison with them, those who are being tortured, as though you yourselves were being tortured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let marriage be held in honor by all, and let the marriage bed be kept undefiled, for God will judge the sexually immoral and adulterers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep your lives free from the love of money, and be content with what you have, for he himself has said, “I will never leave you or forsake you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So we can say with confidence,
“The Lord is my helper;
    I will not be afraid.
What can anyone do to me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember your leaders, those who spoke the word of God to you; consider the outcome of their way of life, and imitate their faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be carried away by all kinds of strange teachings, for it is good for the heart to be strengthened by grace, not by regulations about food, which have not benefited those who observe them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have an altar from which those who officiate in the tent have no right to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bodies of those animals whose blood is brought into the sanctuary by the high priest as a sacrifice for sin are burned outside the camp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore Jesus also suffered outside the city gate in order to sanctify the people by his own blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let us then go to him outside the camp and bear the abuse he endured.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For here we have no lasting city, but we are looking for the city that is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Through him, then, let us continually offer a sacrifice of praise to God, that is, the fruit of lips that confess his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not neglect to do good and to share what you have, for such sacrifices are pleasing to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obey your leaders and submit to them, for they are keeping watch over your souls as those who will give an account. Let them do this with joy and not with sighing, for that would be harmful to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pray for us; we are sure that we have a good conscience, desiring to act honorably in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I urge you all the more to do this, so that I may be restored to you very soon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the God of peace, who brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus, the great shepherd of the sheep, by the blood of the eternal covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: make you complete in everything good so that you may do his will, as he works among us that which is pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory forever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I appeal to you, brothers and sisters, bear with my word of exhortation, for I have written to you briefly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I want you to know that our brother Timothy has been set free, and if he comes in time he will be with me when I see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet all your leaders and all the saints. Those from Italy send you greetings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace be with all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
